events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on April 28, 2024, involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to the mention of vehicle collision in the claim details.
An agent was assigned to handle the case promptly to ensure quick communication and support for the claimant.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment receipt to the claimant confirming the claim has been received and is under review.
The agent requested the claimant to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and medical reports if applicable.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the accident report and photos showing the extent of vehicle damage.
Investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and contacted witnesses to confirm details of the collision.
The investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault in the vehicle accident based on gathered evidence.
The insurance company proposed a settlement offer to cover the repair costs and related expenses to the claimant.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the timely processing and the fairness of the proposed settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved confirming full coverage of the repair expenses as detailed in the settlement agreement.
Payment corresponding to the approved claim amount was transferred to the claimantâ€™s bank account successfully.
The claim file was formally closed after confirming all payments were made and no further queries were raised.
The case documents and records were archived in the system for future reference following the completion of the claim process.
